title: Defense Secretary summons Anthropic’s Amodei over military use of Claude
summary: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has summoned Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei to the Pentagon for a tense discussion over the military's use of Claude. Hegseth has threatened to designate Anthropic a "supply chain risk."

title: The creator economy’s ad revenue problem and India’s AI ambitions
summary: The creator economy is evolving fast, and ad revenue alone isn’t cutting it anymore. YouTubers are launching product lines, acquiring startups, and building actual business empires. In fact, MrBeast’s company bought fintech startup Step, and his chocolate business is outearning his media arm. This isn’t just one creator’s strategy. For many, it’s the new playbook.  On this episode of TechCrunch’s Equity podcast, hosts Kirsten Korosec, Anthony Ha, and Rebecca Bellan unpack how creators are diversifying beyond ads, […]

title: Why creators are ditching ad revenue for chocolate bars and fintech acquisitions

In fact, MrBeast’s company bought fintech startup Step, and his chocolate business is out-earning his media arm. This isn’t just one creator’s strategy. For many, it’s the new playbook.  […]

title: Anthropic-funded group backs candidate attacked by rival AI super PAC
summary: Dueling pro-AI PACs have centered around backing or targeting one New York congressional bid: Alex Bores, whose RAISE Act requires AI developers to disclose safety protocols and report serious system misuse.

title: OpenAI says 18- to 24-year-olds account for nearly 50% of ChatGPT usage in India
summary: The company said on Friday that users between 18 and 24 years of age account for nearly 50% of all messages sent by Indians to ChatGPT, and users under 30 account for 80% of usage in the country.

title: UAE’s G42 teams up with Cerebras to deploy 8 exaflops of compute in India
summary: Abu Dhabi-based tech company G42 has partnered with U.S.-based chipmaker Cerebras to deploy 8 exaflops of compute through a new system in India.

title: Urban vs. Rural: Why Data Centers Are Built Where They Are
summary: Urban hubs still matter, but they’re no longer the only game in town. With expanding power and fiber and intensifying incentives, the next wave of data centers will land across a broader set of geographies.

title: Optical Fiber Prices Are Soaring on AI Demand
summary: Fiber manufacturing capacity has maxed out due to rise in AI and military drone sales, and prices are soaring.

title: Could Texas Overtake Northern Virginia as the Data Center Capital?

title: Beyond GPUs: Why Memory Is the Next Frontier in AI Infrastructure Efficiency
summary: Standards like Compute Express Link are emerging as critical tools for expanding memory capacity, enabling sharing, and improving efficiency, making memory hierarchy design a key factor in optimizing AI infrastructure and reducing costs.

title: Edge Data Centers vs. Edge Devices: Which One Fits Your Strategy?
summary: The decision depends on factors like workload size, sensitivity, location needs, and hardware constraints.
